description:
I would like to start by saying they are super friendly here!!!  
My first time eating here.
It's a nice small sandwich shop. I sat in to enjoy my sandwich with my dad, mother, & grandmother. The sandwich I selected from the menu was the crab sandwich with sourdough bread. I really enjoyed it!!! The crisp of the bread to the seasoned crab. I believe I came at a busy time, that still did not change the friendly workers. They provide great customer service. As I was eating, I seen the employee make a sandwich for a customer that was not on the menu which was very nice of her. I noticed they received many phone calls for customers that were placing orders. All the customers left with smiles which made me happy!! I didn't eat the other half of my sandwich and was wrapping it up.....the employee asked to wrap it for me....I told her thanks but I got it! She even gave me a bag to take it in!!! AWESOME CUSTOMER SERVICE!! They are sweet and very personable!!!
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Found myself having to take a friend to CPMC for a medical procedure and was in search of lunch nearby. Went on Yelp and found this little gem.

Ordered the Italian sub on Dutch crunch bread with provolone cheese and found a seat.  The toasted sandwich was delivered to my table on the curb lickety split.  Meat was tasty, cheese was all melty goodness and the bread was crunchy on the outside and warm and soft on the inside.  Overall a great little sammie!

The staff was quick and attentive and delivered my meal even though this is not that type of restaurant.

The place is small, real small.  Has about 4 seats inside with two tiny tables.  There are three more tables on the sidewalk that can seat about 9 more patrons.

Overall a good bet in Pacific heights and would recommend.
author: Matt F.

description:
Solid, inexpensive, decently sized deli sandwiches. I've usually gone with the Bay Subs special or the Italian and have found them thoroughly warm and satisfying each time. Service is pretty fast at least at non-peak hours, and the folks here are pretty friendly too. 

There isn't much in the way of seating here as it appears to be a grab-and-go place for nearby medical workers and residents, but it's still a hospitable neighborhood outlet if you can grab a seat. Thanks Yelpers for a good find!
author: Vincent L.

description: Having moved from NYC recently, I was happy to see a deli in my neighborhood.  We got a turkey sandwich - it was made nicely but I wish they used thin cut meat bc the thicker slides of turkey they offer.  Seems like it's pretty common for them to run out of their most popular bread so get there early if you'd prefer that.  Try the bulgogi!
author: Anjali P.

description: A pretty decent sandwich, on perhaps too soft dutch. But it's easily the cheapest thing you can eat in the neighborhood and it's a pretty solid option if you want something not bad and not bougie.
author: Misha T.

description: Came here for lunch, and it was awesome! This place is definitely a hole in the wall, so it's easy enough to walk by and miss it. I got the regular gyro at the recommendation of the lady behind the counter. First of all, at around $6, the price is on point. When I received my order my initial reaction was that it was small, but I was wrong! It was the perfect size for me, the meat was flavorful, and the veggies were fresh and had a nice crunch. Definitely stop in and treat yourself to a sandwich or gyro if you're nearby!
author: Rachel D.

description:
I'm definitely confused by the high reviews for this deli and would suggest that big fans of this spot try Rhea's or Roxie's.  The sandwiches at both of those spots far exceed the quality here.

Prices are high relative to size.  The small looks to be about the size of a 6'' Subway sub; I'm used to the "small" sandwich size at other shops being about 150% the size of these.

I was also underwhelmed with the ingredients.  There wasn't a lot of turkey relative to other toppings, the sandwich was constructed in such a way that all the meat was to one side of the sandwich, and the spicy brown mustard was overpowering.

Finally, the sandwich was somehow wrapped in such a way that the paper was inside of the sandwich, meaning that once the cheese melted and re-solidified and I went to remove the paper from the sandwich...it was stuck the cheese and totally pulled the sandwich apart.

If I was in this area and was dying for a sub sandwich, this is edible....it's just not as good as it could be.
author: Tay H.

description: OMG! We were walking through this area and just happened to see it and even if you're walking and you blink, you'd miss this really small really tiny place! The sandwiches were the bomb!! Definitely a must to stop at!
author: Sean D.

description: I have always seen this deli in passing to do my bank runs. One day I decided to stop by here to get lunch. It's a small hole in the wall with a table and a place where they keep the drinks. I got a salami sandwich on soft roll cold . It was 9.00 for a large sandwich. I loved it,it was tasty and juicy there is one thing I can't stand is a dry sandwich. They take cash and cards it's two men making the sandwich's and one lady at the register. There friendly and fast.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Bay Subs is my go to for a tasty, but quick and inexpensive lunch in the area. I always get their tuna melt on dutch crunch, but I'm sure their other combinations are just as good! The deli is owned and operated by a sweet couple who are multitasking superstars. They know exactly how to field a long line and how to get orders out efficiently, which is why they get 5 shining stars.

Tips:

- call in your order ahead of time: (415) 346-3888
- cash only
author: Monica M.

description:
I've been eyeing this place for some time since I'm always over at Pete's across the street. Finally came in today and ordered the bulgogi sandwich. Now the sandwich is quite tasty. The problem I had is the way they cut the meat on this sandwich. It's cut up in very small pieces so the meat tends to fall out of the bread. I would prefer larger piece which would probably resolve that issue. However, like I said, it was tasty. The bread was fresh and toasted, I really liked that. The lettuce was also fresh, not limp or wilted. 

I will come back for the pastrami and the chicken pesto. They sell a small and large sandwich. This was my first time there, so I got the small. But you might as well get the large.
author: Anthony W.

description:
CASH ONLY! (under $9 I think)

Strange that I have lived in this neighborhood for 20 years and never been here.

I ordered the gyro, but I think I made a tactical error, I spied a heated turkey and cheese that looked delightful!

My gyro was okay - the best part about it was the price $5.95 - for that neighborhood that is a STEAL!

It was a good size just for a lunch - not super huge, just enough.  Will go back to try another flavor of dub
author: Amy W.

description: Sandwich Size was small for there Large, your better off going to Subway to get a Foot Long  I would hate to see there Small, plus I paid  12 Bucks what a rip off, I asked the Lady this is your Large?? she said yes... First and Last time here!! Sorry People not worth it.
author: Rudy L.

description:
Being Vegan, I asked for their Veggie Sandwich with sprouts minus the puss-and-blood-traced cheese and asked if i could substitute Hummus instead.

"Cost extra!" said the owner-lady behind the counter in a charged tone, both of us knowing well that a knife spread of chickpea hummus is cheaper than a slice of cheese.  I forked out the extra 70 cents or whatever it was.  

It was your average sandwich of Subway caliber.  Hardly a place to sit down in this small establishment, but cute because of its smallness and hidden off-Fillmore location.  It's a good place to go if you need a quick sandwich in snooty Pac Heights.
author: Khash C.

description: Wonderful little sandwich shop run by some very nice people. It is within easy walking distance of the hospital. They toast the sandwiches perfectly - crispy, but still soft inside. I had the bulgogi and the person I went with had the veggie sandwich. Both were very good and we left nothing but crumbs. Seating and space is very limited, so accept that you may need to take it to go if a table doesn't open up while you wait.
author: Art B.

description:
Bay Subs and Deli is BOMB! I use to work in CPMC in Pacific Heights.  My co-workers use to order sandwiches every Thursdays.  We call in the order, and one of us picks it up.

I always get the Chicken Pesto Sandwich on dutch crunch, no mustard, light mayo and everything else that comes with it.  I've also ordered Pastrami Sandwiches to take home to my husband and daughter and they absolutely love it.

I had the chance to work a few days at the hospital again, and ordered my favorite sandwich.

It's a small place, so it's probably best to order ahead and pick up.  If you order there, you will most likely wait outside and sit outside.  There are only two very small tables inside that can sit 2-3 people.

The lady in the counter is pleasant and very friendly.  Love this place!
author: Melinda R.

description:
This was one of my go-to sandwich spots when I lived in the neighborhood. It's literally a hole-in-the-wall mom & pop shop. The mom & pop are the ones preparing the sandwiches in their little kitchen while the daughter is ringing up customers at the register. As I mentioned, this place is the size of a shoe box, so after you place your order you pretty much have to wait outside on the sidewalk for them to call your name/number.

My go-to was always their regular turkey/bacon sub (plenty of deli meats, shredded lettuce, tomato, cheese of your choice, mustard, mayo, on a toasted sweet roll). Never too oily or greasy or inundated with condiments. My sub always hit the spot! You can get a larger sandwich for a few dollars more, but their regular size would always satisfy my appetite.
Now back when I lived in the hood 4 years ago, they only accepted cash (which was kind of annoying since I only carry a debit card in my wallet). But on my recent visit, I was pleasantly surprised to see that they now accept most cards with a minimum $8 purchase.

I know that they also serve Gyros and a few other goodies. But for me, if you walk into a place called Bay Subs & Deli, you should stick with the sandwiches. And for just $7, they're very easy on the pocket book. 

I only wish they had a location in North Bay.
author: Kevin B.

description:
Small quaint sandwich shop with a couple inside tables and three outdoor. Have a solid selection of cold and hot deli subs plus a gyro. Price is excellent for the Bay Area. 

Gyro Extra had a soft pita, right size portions of meat and tasty tzatziki sauce. Also comes in a paper wrapper making it easier to eat than most I've had. 

Friendly staff, quick and sometimes a line. 

Overall highly recommended.
author: Aaron C.

description: Love this spot great sandwiches! Call ahead the line gets long at lunch. I recommend the BLT with avocado on Dutch Crunch.
author: Garner M.

description:
Very nice. The line was a bit long and there wasn't really room to wait but sandwich was better than expected. The price was typical for SF and fairly low compared to other places.

Overall not a bad place and would love to come back :)
author: Ayan And Alice A.

description:
The staff at Bay Subs are very friendly, the Korean lady that runs the place is super friendly. They offer classic sandwich options as well as some Korean fusion sandwiches like a bulgogi sandwich. I like to order the Italian sub that comes with salami, mortadella, and provolone cheese.  You can substitute cheese options on your sandwiches, and choose from different rolls or breads as well.

This place gets packed during lunch traffic time 11:45 am - 1 pm, so order ahead.  I witnessed a very nice bonding moment with the Korean lady owner, and a small boy had obviously been going there for years with his Father. She came out from behind the counter to give the boy a strong hug, and it demonstrated how nice the people are here and the relationships formed with some of the loyal customers. I will keep coming back anytime I'm in the area, and recommend you stop by for a really good sandwich!
author: Marlon T.

description: I just started a new job nearby and this has become my go-to lunch spot. The sandwiches are really good and taste fresh. I usually get the Italian or meatball sub. It's gets pretty busy around lunch time but the owner does a great job expediting the orders, and she is very friendly as well!
author: Amanda C.

description:
Bay Subs is my clutch place for when my lunch options are limited on the weekends. The family that runs it is super sweet and the sandwiches are as fresh as they can get. I usually get the bulgogi beef or teriyaki chicken sandwiches. 

It's really a pick up and go place since there are a couple tables inside and outside, but no restrooms for customers (I don't think). Call ahead in advance as the line can get long
author: Lisa X.

description:
Delicious cheap sandwiches! The owners are really nice and the service was quick. There's very little seating inside and the line gets pretty long during lunchtime.

Got the large bulgogi sandwich for $9. It came on a warm dutch crunch roll with mayo, lettuce, and tomatoes. The serving amount of beef was generous and half of the sandwich was enough to fill me up. Would definitely be back here again!
author: Linda X.

description: My mom was in the hospital at CPMC and was looking for a place to pick up lunch. The couple are very nice. I ordered the Italian sub it was delicious. Note that you must spend at least $8 to use your card. Would go back if I'm in the area.
author: Michael H.

description: Best meatball sub! Tasty, fresh, inexpensive. Not sure about anything else they offer, but there's always a line so I assume it's all good.
author: Nancy R.

description: Love this little mom and pop shop. The service is super friendly and the price is very good
author: Cornelius V.

description:
Cute mom and pop sandwich shop. I love giving my business to places like this! There is a giant line of hungry people waiting to order, but the lady works VERY quickly to get the orders in and given out efficiently. I've never seen someone scramble like her. 

The sandwich was very good. I recommend getting a large. I was able to eat the entire thing without an issue.
author: Jen B.

description:
A very nice lady took my order and told me she hopes I enjoy, but it may not be as good as my mom's! Sorry mom, this rocks!

This is just the sub place I was hoping for in pac heights! I ordered the beef bulgogi and everything was done to perfection. The bread toasted and not too thick, onions sliced very thinly, meat sweetly marinated and cooked to create texture on the outside. All layered, portioned, and sliced in a way that you can throw a sub in your backpack and open it to find it looks exactly the way it did before they wrapped it. Definitely coming back!
author: Sarah O.

description: Bay subs was the first place we ate when we moved to SF from Chicago and my first experience with Dutch crunch. Omg I will never order a sub on anything other than Dutch crunch ever again. Sandwiches are our go to for weekend picnics and bay subs is the best we have tried in SF. We usually order an Italian and a #1 on Dutch crunch. The woman who takes the orders could not be nicer. My only wish is that hey we're open on Sunday!
author: Emily S.

description: Their bulgogi sandwiches are the best! During lunchtime the lines are quite long so I would suggest calling in to make your order and then picking up
author: Jill F.

description: This is the best sandwich place.  The service is wonderful and the lady owner is very sweet.  It can get busy during lunch and so I recommend ordering ahead.  I love the veggie sandwich!
author: J N.

description:
Really good reasonably priced subs, served warm. Place is small, really small, and hot inside. The owner knew the first name and order of the 5 people that walked in after me. Always a nice touch.

Better than Mr. Pickles and Subway. You can't compare it to Ike's because its simply not the same. Sandwiches are dense and delicious and a size small will be plenty for 90% of all people, even buff pac heights dads.

Prices are extremely reasonable for sf ranging from $7-$9

The only drawback is that between 12-1:30 the sandwiches take a while. 2 sandwiches took around 15 minutes.
author: Peter T.

description: Got the beef bulgogi sandwich for lunch around 1pm on a weekday. There was still a 15-20min wait, but definitely worth the try. Although the beef bolgogi was delicious, I didn't like it that much in a sandwich, and would want it in rice.
author: Daisy L.

description:
This place is my favorite ever! I go here at least 3 times a week. The people that work there are the LOVELIEST people in the world, and they are so sweet and caring. I love them. 
Their sandwiches are definitely the best in the bay. The ingredients are so fresh, and the sandwich is so toasty and warm and perfect. I get a large veggie (everything on) on dutch crunch with provolone. Best thing in the world!
author: Madeleine M.

description:
Small subs place that gets really busy for lunch on weekdays.  
Not gourmet sandwiches, just exactly what you would expect out of a hole in the wall.
The lady at the counter is great, even though she gets busy at times.
author: T B.

description: Woman that takes your order is super friendly.  My go to sandwich is always Turkey, and the turkey they use taste like turkey roll at your supermarket.  It is not like the fresh roasted turkey served at the Grove down the street.  The bread choices are good and quality of bread also good.  However, with all the choices around the area for lunch and turkey usually one of the best sellers, the quality just does not cut it for me.
author: Jerry J.

description: A real gem to the Fillmore neighborhood. Amazing classic deli and delicious Korean fusion styled sandwiches as well! Charming and hardworking team here who always is happy to see people come in to enjoy their food. There's a Mollie stones around the corner but I gladly take the extra block up the street just for Baysubs!
author: Marion B.

description:
Had a delicious toasted sourdough Italian sandwich, very very friendly staff and affordable too. This might be my Tuesday lunch spot from now on! 

Update: here for the second time. Tried the ham sandwich on Dutch crunch - it's great!!!
author: Marthe N.

description: Nestled in the upscale pacific heights next to the much more expensive Fillmore st is a wonderful mom and pop shop sandwich. The sandwiches are delicious and very affordable, you get a huge sandwich for a small .  I tried the bulgogi sandwich which was unique , sweet and tasty. Really fast and great service. Highly recommend , refreshing to see places like this in SF
author: Pat C.

description:
Do not be deceived by the looks of this place, this is definitely what you would call a hole in the wall but they make some seriously good sandwiches! I usually come on my lunch break & it can get extremely crowded so I recommend calling in your order ahead of time if you can. 

I've gotten the Bay Subs Special #1 & the classic BLT & I highly recommend the dutch crutch roll which makes the sandwich that much better! And definitely worth it to add the chips + drink combo.

Again, this place is pretty small so if you get lucky you might be able to snag one of the few seats they have. Definitely an easy grab and go affordable lunch & the owner is super sweet!
author: Nicole L.

description:
if you're using a credit/debit card the minimum purchase is $8, so keep that in mind.  i was only going to get a regular gyro but then added a bag of chips and a 
Stewart's soda to bring my total to $8.45.  a fair price, considering the location and taste.  (if you went to Subway and got a similar meal it'd be around 6.50 probably)  

i liked their sauce and the flatbread they used!! it was nice and fluffy and squishy, unlike other places i've been to in SF that use an extremely thin outer bread.  nice homey Korean folks ran the place and i felt right at home :)  thanks for the delicious meal !  
- a poor student
author: Amanda J.

description: BLTA is delicious here. Really awesome cheap lunch option compared to everything else in the area. There is a minimum for using card ($8), so buying just a sandwich means you have to pay cash.
author: Elisa L.

description: My go to sandwich shop in Pacific Heights. As I typically arrive later in the day, they don't always have the wide assortment of bread - but have never been disappointed with the available options. Great food and great owners!
author: Maureen K.

description:
Owners are always there! This is probably your only mom and pop shop in Pacific Heights!! Mia runs the cashier and her husband makes the sandwichs! Everything is delicious!!!! I've tried everything but the meatball sandwich,  I'll try it out one day.

My favs and go to sandwichs are the Bay Sub #1 and the Korean Sandwichs!!!  (Bulgogi Chicken and Beef)  soooo good, very tasty! They also toast it, so it's nice and crunchy!! 

Mia's customer service is incredible!  She really knows her customers. She greets almost everyone by name!!! And knows their order!!! Wow!!! I will at times order on the phone and she recognizes my voice!  That's amazing!  

They are genuinely kind!  I have seen them shopping at my local market and costco!! And they recognize me outside of their shop! So cute!
author: Candice V.

description:
Pretty upset.  I ordered the Turkey meets Bacon sandwich and there was hardly any bacon in the sandwich.  I was really disappointed and will bring it up if and when I go there in the future!

Came here again to give them another shot, but I was even more disappointed.  The only bread they had was multigrain.  What's the point in being in business, if you are not prepared and well stocked.  And for crime out loud, hire more people.  Not fair for someone to have to wait close to 25 minutes for a sandwich.  This place blows.
author: Terry S.

description: Best place in sf. Been coming here for 5 years! Mia and her husband treat everybody like family
author: John K.

description: Small neighborhood sandwich spot in Pac Heights just off Fillmore.  Great service and some of the best sandwiches I've had.  Reasonably priced, as well!  Give them a shot when you're in town!
author: Angela R.

description: BLT with Avocado was tasty, but the small size sandwich is "European small", not "American small".  Felt like not much food for $7.  Do yourself a favor and order a large.  This place also doesn't have much seating because it's so small.  Most folks were just getting takeout.
author: Cy C.

description: This is my go-to sandwich place in the city. Not only is the entire menu of sandwiches delicious, but they have the greatest service of any sandwich place I've ever been to. I feel at home every time I stop by. Mia and Joe are the best! Thanks so much!!!
author: Miller B.

description:
Welp, this place is amazing. It's the perfect place to pick up 2 sandwiches for yourself. That's because they do small and large sandwiches for each menu item, and both are extremely reasonably priced.

I went with my classic sandwich favorite, the meatball sub (small) and it was legit. the soft roll tasted great and they toast it perfectly, and the meat was excellent quality and cooked just right. Also, the key to a meatball Sando is that it's "neat" in the sense that you can eat it somewhat easily. They nailed it.

Also got the bay sub special #1 - has all the meats. Just incredible, you need to try it to know.

Less than $15 for a large and small sub, both tasty and made perfectly? Done.
author: Andrew R.

description: I have lived nearby for many years and only finally discovered this gem in the last year. All subs are toasted and absolutely delicious. My personal favorite is the teriyaki beef. But the greatest attribute of this business is the amazingly friendly staff...and they all work SO hard. I love supporting a small, local business that genuinely cares about their product and their customers. TIP: they are always busy at lunch, so call ahead with your order.
author: Don D.

description: Love this little place.  Best sandwich shop in the area.  Wonderful customer service.  Best to go in the early lunch hours because it's usually packed especially since the construction workers also enjoy this place.
author: Toblessedtobestressed G.

description: Amazing little sandwich shop. I'm here at least twice a week. It is always the same lady running the show and she is super friendly!!
author: David M.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of this place for a quick and easy lunch. I usually come here in the middle of work where my lunch hour is anywhere from 30-60 minutes depending on the day and the flow of work. I love that I never have to order ahead at this place to get my sandwich ready within 10 minutes. But of course, ordering ahead is faster! 

I usually get the Pastrami sandwich, which you can probably never go wrong with ANYWHERE! But I do like here. 

If it's not he pastrami sandwich, then it's the crab sandwich! It's marinated so it's nice and juicy. My coworkers all love this one, and well, that's basically why I tried it to begin with! 

My coworkers also get the chicken sandwiches but I love the pastrami and crab sandwiches to try another. Give me a few more months and maybe I'll end up trying those. We shall see! 

By the way, this place is super affordable! Most small sandwiches are $5.45 and large sandwiches are $7.45. Depending on your appetite, you can walk away full with spending as little as $4! My coworkers and I sometimes share so just really makes for a great, quick, easy, and affordable meal! 

PS the cashier (maybe she's the owner) is super sweet and she's always smiling and happy to help you with your order!
author: Connie Y.

description: Owners are very sweet! The crab sandwich is awesome. It's best to order ahead of time so you don't wait it line. I wish this place was bigger and had more seating bc there are only two tables but other than that, no complaints! The sandwiches and gyros are a reasonable price and great portion!
author: Stacy G.

description:
After finding out the hard way that B Patisserie's day off is Monday, we found this literal modern day hole in the wall.  Yelping for a neighborhood gyro place, I found this convenient lunch spot just off of Fillmore Street.  My friend had a veggie gyro (aka wrap) while I had a small Italian sub on a Dutch crunch roll.
Expecting just a gut filling experience, I was pleasantly surprised  when my smoking hot (temperature wise) sandwich arrived.  Packed with a variety of Italian meats that, of course, included salami, my sammy offered the textural contrast of the melting cheese and crunchy warm bread.  We ate at one of their two indoor tables.  There are also a couple of sidewalk tables for those rare warm sunny San Francisco days.
A mix of neighborhood locals and work service staff ordered as we ate as it is literally just down the block from CPMC. Love hitting these small local owned businesses, especially when they serve good food.  Let's put it this way; I'm still thinking about that meal and it's been almost two weeks!
author: Mike C.

description: Come here for lunch a lot and order the crab salad sandwich. Always great, amazing service and really well priced.
author: Sean G.

description: Tried chicken pesto sandwich, crab sandwich, and beef bulgogi sandwich. They were all awesome. Although the shop is very small and seats are limited, subs there are very good.
author: Hwansoo S.

description: Sweetest lady who always remembers my name and everyone else's! The sandwiches are always perfect and even though it some times takes awhile it's because everyone in the neighborhood eats here!! Worth the wait!
author: Summer T.

description: I found Bay Subs since its down the street from my job. I love their hot sandwiches and the service as well. I get Italian salami with provolone and jalapenos, avocado (& the usual lettuce,tomato, pickles) on Dutch crunch or soft roll. YUM!!!
author: Maria S.

description: Toasted subs are good. Nice couple that owns this place (and I always prefer family-run businesses - because they are a dying breed now in SF as these businesses are closing because if high rents; support local people;and often higher standards with what you get when there is pride of ownership). This couple is lovely. Although I Iove these subs, Marina Sub is still my favorite.
author: Ruth C.

description: My daughter and I tried the Gyros.  We asked for more of the white dressing.  The lady gave us perfect gyros and they're not even Greek!  Better than the Greek place at Westlake.  We will have the same every time we're in the area.
author: Lori C.

description: I came here because of its high ratings and reviews and well, they were all right! I ordered a large Baysubs special #1 on a Dutch crunch and it was pretty good! The bread was a perfect level of crunchiness. I didn't have to wait in a line, contrary to what I was expecting, maybe because I was there before most people go to lunch. The lady who took my order was exceptionally friendly and made conversation with everyone who ordered there and even knew people by their first names. Even though there wasn't too much space to eat inside, the service was what made this place great.
author: Sean S.

description: This place is near my doctor's and I always noticed how busy it was there for lunch.  So one day after a recent appointment, I decided to pick up some lunch.  I wanted to try a couple sandwiches so I ordered the crab salad and a BLT.  Order the large as this will fill you up and you might have a few bites leftover for a snack.  We really enjoyed the crab salad sandwich immensely as it had plenty of crab and was creamy just right - I would definitely order this one again!  The BLT was good with a bit of avocado.  It's a popular little place for all the CPMC staff and shops around the area, so wait time at lunch time can be around 20 minutes or so, so plan for it.  But it is definitely worth it!  It's a tiny stop, with some seating inside and a few seats outside.  Service is friendly and helpful.  This is definitely a great neighborhood find!
author: Maile N.

description:
Great sandwiches that don't skimp on the meat a la subway. My favorites are the #1 Special and the Terriyaki beef or chicken. I work around the corner from here, so this my go-to if I'm looking for a simple non-bourgeois meal (which can be hard on filmore). 

Extra bonus: couple that runs the joint is very sweet and the service has always been prompt.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
YUM YUM YUM!!

Delicious huge sandwiches with top quality ingredients served by people that really seem to care that you are happy and satisfied with their product and service.

As with most popular places in the city I would suggest calling in your order to avoid a lunch rush hour wait.

The crab sandwich is my favorite along with a old fashioned roast beef with swiss on rye.

Cant get much better service than you get here and we have to give 5 stars!!!
author: Brown B.

description:
I love bay subs! :) The food is fresh, tasty, a good size, and a good deal. The owner is adorable and such a sweetheart. If you come here a few times, she'll remember your name and your order. She always has a smile on her face. I know it makes me smile too every time I see her. :D It's a bit small to eat in, but you can make space for a tiny group inside or outside. Most people I know drop by for quick take out, which as another pro, you can call in and order. 

I recommend the BLT with avocado and the korean kalbi. Yummm.
author: Grace T.

description: I tried the gyro. Not bad considering it's a sub place. I arrived at the end of the day so my bread choices for my sandwich was limited.  Didn't matter as it chock full of meat and fixings. Very tasty and great the second day as well.
author: M P.

description: Love my turkey special sandwich. It was my first time visit after searching from yelp and it really worths a try. The lady cashier at the counter was friendly and prompt. I ordered a large turkey special with pesto sauce and with everything in it. The Dutch crunch bread is crispy and fresh. Turkey meat and all the condiments were nicely wrapped inside the crispy bread without any excessive sauce leaking out the wrapping paper.  I don't like messy sandwiches wrapping especially when you have lunch on the go. There are interesting options, such as bulgogi beef and bulgogi chicken sandwich. May try them next time. I was lucky enough to get there at the beginning of lunch crowd but they work pretty fast with great customer services even when there were lots of phone calls ringing non stop for ordering sandwiches pick-up.
author: Janice T.

description: This little hole in the wall puts out a large volume of tasty sandos.  Don't go at the prime lunch time of 12-1pm, if you can call your own shot for taking lunch.  Very friendly and have no problems taking phone orders either.  My go to sando shop  in the Pac.
author: Walt L.

description: Bay Subs and Deli is my favorite sandwich place in the Bay Area!  Since I work in the South Bay and BS&D is closed on Sundays, I love Saturdays and I take every chance I can get to work from home!
author: Ben M.

description: This is my most favorite sandwich shop in San Francisco, even above Ikes. The owners are super friendly and have an elaborate menu of delicious sandwiches. Call ahead if you know what you want. During lunch hours, the line can get pretty long.
author: R S.

description:
Best sandwiches around the area. 

Came here a handful of times and I always get the Bay Sub Specials. Sandwich is always wet (in a good way) and crunchy. It's a bit oily though but overall still good! Although the price is a bit on the expensive side for a sandwich, it's pretty cheap considering the neighborhood. 

***Parking***: Metered or residential parking. Good luck finding residential.

Cash or Credit accepted!
author: Johnny G.

description: Delicious subs on fresh bread. Great service with a smile and a reasonable price. You can't beat that!
author: Sharlene H.

description: I had the Chicken Pesto Sandwhich on Wheat it was very delicious! I tried b/c someone posted a picture and it looked pretty good, so I decided to go for it. =)
author: D M.

description:
Love this place!  

I have ordered at least half the menu and everything has been great.  One deli on the area too.
author: Mike B.

description:
A great, locally owned sandwich shop. The prices (~$6 small / ~$8 large) are not bad for the quality of sandwich they deliver here. The service is always super friendly. You may have to wait 10-15 minutes if they are really busy, but it's worth it.

Try: Baysubs Special Sub, Baysubs Special Sub #2, BLT w/ Avocado or Regular Sub

CLOSED SUNDAYS - This bit me once ... ok, twice.
author: Paul B.

description:
I tried this place again because I like gyros on pita bread and they had changed owners since I was there last time. The old place had gyros that weren't very good; they were the Kronos pre-made meat that was nuked. The tsaziki sauce was extremely salty. The menu was the same but I gave it a try. Turns out the gyros was exactly the same too. 
Still looking for a good gyros locally.
I wonder if the people selling these actually taste them.
author: Jeff W.

description: Always delicious. The prices are sooo good too. BLT with avocado is my go-to, it's amazing and full of flavor. Their Korean sandwiches are great as well and super filling
author: Victoria G.

description: This place is spectacular. I've eaten every meal here for three days. I would get routine healthcare at Baysubs if they offered check ups. I'd ask them for financial advice. Hell, I'd ask them to perform my son's bris. Try the BLT + avocado, really great.
author: Sfw Q.

description: I had the BLT with avocados. They had our orders ready quickly. It's a small family owned place. The owners are really sweet. I recommend this place for delicious sandwiches/ subs. The prices are reasonable.
author: Ana C.

description: Why on earth this place has so many raving reviews? I had Beef Teriyaki Sub, which was just standard, nothing impressive, bunch of Korean Fried Beef (not Teriyaki really, but that's fine) reheated in microwave, packed in a sub with tomato, cabbage, onion, mayo and heated again in an electric oven to get the bread crusty. No particular distinctive taste in it. This place seems to have many regular patrons, as I was waiting people were showing up and it was apparent that they are regulars. Perhaps once you develop the attachment you are willing to post 5-star review, but IMHO food does not warrant it.
author: Grzegorz J.

description: Would give the place 4.5 stars. The place is really small, it fits about 4 people but there is seating outside!! I got a gyro and it was delicious! I would go again and highly recommend it
author: Unni P.

description: Fresh,hot,tasty Gyro made from the friendly Asian owner who was so pleasant and cherrful! The price is reasonable too#
author: Karen F.

description: this place is just a simple, no frills sandwich shop pumping out delicious sandwiches. definitely worth calling in your order so you don't have to wait (they are super popular around the lunch hour for a very good reason). the owner running the register is very sweet and makes a genuine effort to remember your name. I'm a fan!
author: Jen H.

description: The best crab sandwiches even though they use imitation crab meat, it's delicious. I come from out-of-town just to get it, if I'm in the neighborhood. Not cheap so order the largest size to have more....the owner is really nice, friendly and tries to speed things up
author: IM P.

description:
It's a very basic sandwich shop with standard pricing, small sandwiches are around $6 and larges are around $8, they toast the bread. Limited seating area for only 8 -10 people. Bay Subs also sells gyros, which were extremely popular. They had a few good vegetarian choices (it's not like ike's in faux meat or crazy selection by any means). The Korean couple that own the shop were really friendly. 

I don't really know what it is about Bay Subs & Deli, such a basic, simple sandwich but really, really good! Some of the best, quick on-the-go food in Pacific Heights. I wish they were open on Sundays too!
author: Shannon Z.

description: My special corner of Heaven. Fantastic sandwiches, great price for the proportions. Friendly people, always smiles and great personalities. My favorite shop!
author: Alex R.

description:
I absolutely love this place which is luckily only a few blocks from my apartment.

The gyros and sandwiches are all generally amazing. Make sure to try the tzatziki sauce and maybe one of the fresh cookies/brownies for dessert!

Also the couple who seem to be the owners are so friendly and welcoming. It's almost worth going just to experience the good customer service.
author: Marc C.

description: I often pass by this store and see a long line, so I gave a try; and understood why there always is a long line. Gyro I had was full of flavor yet cheap. I would come back to this shop regularly if I work or live near by. :-( Feel sad that I don't have a similar shop near my places.
author: In-Sung L.

description:
It was moving in day to the Pacific Heights area. After finding many sit down restaurants, we found Bay Subs.
You will miss this place if it's door is blocked with customers,  two tables outside will be you landmark! Very small as you enter (there is usually a line, which only takes about 2 people to make one)

First, let me tell you, my mouth is watering as I write this!!!!  
They had Bulgogi... this mouth watering food is my favorite (lived in Korea for a couple of years....fyi, love me some Korean food).
 I'm not sure if this is a chain sandwich place....I've only had the Large Bulgogi Chicken Sandwich. and homemade brownies. It's that good, can't find myself to order anything else.  
The owners remembered me after my visit,  always an experience when that happens at any establishment. This lovely family owned business is a must when your in a sandwich mood!.
Forgot to mention.....great bread!!
author: Quinn S.
Brian J.

description:
The Italian sandwich was very good. The pretty crunchy/substantial wheat roll didn't get soggy, there was plenty of flavorful meat & cheese, a somewhat limited selection of vegetables, and it wasn't too greasy. 

The dressing they use is oil and vinegar based, and tastes like olive oil.

The large sandwich is more like a medium in most other places, and it's $8. So it's quite expensive, but you're paying for the area. Plus it's better quality that most.

They accept credit cards, with a minimum. If you don't meet the minimum they add a 50 cent surcharge.

It seems to be owned and run by an Asian or Korean couple, and the service is efficient and relatively friendly for an ethnic place.
author: Jacqueline A.

description:
This little (really little) spot is great for straight up sandwiches. I get a salami sandwich toasted with everything on it and I have also tried their avocado vegetarian sandwich which was pretty good too. They have a good variety of meat, chips, and drinks. I appreciate that they will toast any sandwich the bread and meat by request. The prices are good, $6 or so for a small sandwich (perfect size), they have a few seats indoors, and three tables outside. It seems to be run by a husband and wife and one staff person.

Perfect size sandwiches for one person, nice staff, good prices, especially in this area of SF. I've been here several times and will def go back!
author: Melissa B.

description: Bay Subs & Deli, what can I say... if you're jonzen for a juicy submarine sandwich, and your up on the Fillmore in San Francisco, these guys will satisfy your hunger here.  The owners are quite friendly ;-) and always remember your favorite sandwich. I especially recommend their Teriyaki sandwich; which uses some tasty Korean Kalbi marinated beef. Love these guys!
author: Paul M.

description: Love this place! The owners are really cute, the sandwiches are great. Highly recommend
author: Nikunj K.

description: I work near the Filmore area and Bay Subs is the perfect place to grab a sandwich for a quick lunch. I always call in my order and they have my order ready by the time I pick it up. I usually order the crab sandwich or the Italian sandwich in a soft roll and recommend getting a large. If you are looking for a delicious and cheap lunch, this is definitely the spot.
author: Mikaila O.

description: Oh em gee! Every time I eat here it gets even better. I just ordered the chicken pesto sandwich with some added avocados and tomatoes. Wow! I wish I had another one to scarf down. Aside from the sandwiches being absolutely delectable, the owner who takes your order is literally the sweetest lady you'll ever meet...and she remembers EVERYTHING. My husband works nearby so he comes more often than I do. Maybe I've met her three times? How impressive is this, she remembered I don't like mayo or mustard. She also remembered our dog's name, and I didn't even have to tell her what my hubby wanted...she had already written it down. If you're strolling down Filmore or in the Pac Heights area and craving a sandwich, do yourself a favor and GO TO BAY SUBS.
author: Kelsey K.

description: Nothing new.  Just wanted to say that one of the things I love about SF is places like this.  A small, no frills neighborhood spot serving up good to great subs/gyros at a fair price, quickly and with a genuine smile.  I second those who say they wish they had a place like this closer to home.  When I'm in the neighborhood and looking for tasty food to take home, this is one of my first choices.
author: Steve S.

description: Super casual but tasty, heated subs and sandwiches.  Amazingly, they got my order wrong when I was the only customer in the store, but when I got home with my take-away order, the sub was still delicious.  There are a few seats here, but it's super cramped, so this is more of a take-away sport.  Would recommend for a quick casual lunch or a picnic sandwich.
author: Marcin M.

description: Awesome owners and amazing pita sandwiches... Only wish they were open later on weeknights!
author: Garrett B.

description: Bomb sandwich- I got the Chicken breast w/ pesto (took the pesto off though) and added bacon. The sandwich was cooked perfect, melt in your mouth type flavor. Will definitely be returning, this place knows what theyre doing.
author: Nikko J.

description:
I just got introduced to Bay Subs last week and have already eaten 4 sandwiches. The place is fantastic!

It's a tiny spot on Sacramento right off the Filmore Street hooplah. Two tables inside, Two tables outside.

Subs are 8.5 or 9 out of 10 where 10 is a Marina Subs caliber sandwich. The drink selection is 10 out of 10 on any non-alcoholic beverage scale. Chip selection is adequate, though the main event is clearly the sandwiches. Bonus points for having dutch crunch as a bread option. Fresh baked cookies on the counter are surprisingly delicious. 

Best of all, though, is the owner. She is the most pleasant person to talk to. I went in there 4 times in one week and never saw an expression on her face other than pure elation. She loves the shop and her customers, that much is clear!
author: Austin O.

description: Great place! Really nice owners, my go to place for quick food near Fillmore. I'm a big fan of BaySubs. Good sandwiches across the board - my personal favorite is the gyros
author: Zarina K.

description:
Sauce and floss.

Need more cowbell: http://youtu.be/BjsUf_oIgp0

And more barbecue sauce.

Korean bulgogi chicken was a nice change from the usual sandwich offerings. Wheat roll. Plenty of chicken. Lettuce and tomato.

Just too light on the sauce. Barely any was used. End result was drier than expected and missing prominent flavor.

Service was nice. As was the six dollar price.

So more sauce please. And bring floss. You'll need it after eating this kind of chicken. Or go with a homemade chocolate chip cookie. Lots of buttery chocolate. Lots of good.

More cowbell is your choice too.
author: Jason B.

description: Fast & yummy food & for a good price,got a yummy bulgogi large sandwich with a soda for just under 9$:D
author: Chris S.

description: Keeping it short and to the point -- the sandwiches are a thing of beauty. Made quickly and with care, delicious as you can imagine and as fresh as all get out. I wish this place had more locations, but I feel lucky whenever I can grab a bite here. AMAZING VALUE FOR WHAT YOU GET, AND UTTERLY DELICIOUS.
author: Vincent C.

description: Delicious homemade brownie & veggie sandwich. Will be back since it's so convenient to my office.
author: Jonathan K.

description:
I popped in here a couple of times. The owner is super friendly lady. She remembered my name the second time I went.

The sandwiches are above average, but it's quick. If you want a sub "to go" then this is a good place because it's small and has limited seating.
author: Taylor C.

description: Sandwiches are good but very slow service. Waited over 20 min for my sandwich. Hire more help.
author: Michael T.

description: They charge you for using your credit card if you purchase less than $10. So I ended up buying a large crab salad on sourdough, a bag of chips and a drink. The fake crab sandwich was pretty tasty, I was also super starving!
author: Karen T.

description: Best freshly made and baked sandwiches on the Fillmore!  Always nice to grab a quick sandwich and sit outside grabbing some sun and people watching! Mia, the owner, is super sweet and nice and does all she can to make you the best sandwich! Enjoy!
author: Paul C.

description: The people who work here are so nice.  The place is tiny and only has two tables.  I love their BLT.  It's a cute little place if you're on the go and want to support a little business.  Great customer service.  Would definitely recommend and come back.
author: k h.

description: Had an orientation at the CPMC and during lunch break, one of my classmates suggested to try this sandwich place.  I got the turkey special with cranberry sauce and I added bacon.  Deeeeelish! I was so hungry so I didn't get to take a picture so I am sorry :( But for such a cheap price it was good choice! I'll definitely come back and write an update next time!
author: Lisa L.

description: My Bay Special #2 sub on multigrain bread was AWESOME. Quality meats, cheese, and bread. Much better than the competition. And Bay Sub doesn't coat thebread with rubber compound, like Subway.
author: Ichor B.

description: Got a small BLT avocado sandwich on dutch crunch. It was very well made, but the sandwich was about the size of my hand... which is pretty small. About $6 for a small and $8 for a large
author: Angela H.

description:
One of my favorite lunch spots on Fillmore! 

You can easily walk past this place and not think twice about it -- but it's one of the best places around for sandwiches.  The owners are super friendly and remember you by name & what you like to order, and the food is super solid!  Gyros are awesome... can't get enough.

Very reasonable prices compared to other lunch options on Fillmore (it seems like everything on this street is more expensive than it would be elsewhere?) so if you want something delicious, quick, inexpensive, and friendly service, this is your place.
author: Tommy V.

description: I consider the benchmark of any sandwich shop the straight up Italian sub. This place delivered, while not the best and not the worst but the sweet as pie owners were so nice that they get an extra star. Every sandwich was prepared to order so be prepared for a wait but strike up a conversation and the time will fly by. I only wish they had a better chip selection.
author: Kim K.

description: Love this place! It's run by a middle aged couple who give nothing but the best service (the wife is so sweet). They make hot subs to order and their ingredients are always super fresh. Their subs never fail to hit the spot :)
author: Chelsea M.

description: OK subs.  They have a tendancy to toast the sandwich after they put the lettuce on it.  This makes for some slimy, brown lettuce, which is unfortunate.
author: K G.

description: I eat here almost daily for lunch! Hands down THE best subs in the Bay Area!!!
author: James A.

description: they have THE BEST subs here, and the couple that owns it could not be sweeter. i recommend this place for anyone that has a hankering for an absolutely delicious sandwich.
author: Nicolette A.

description: Great service, Mia is very friendly and remembers your order.  I like the sandwiches - reasonably priced and sized, tasty.
author: Glenn S.

description: Came here on a Saturday half an hour before close. They were out of all rolls and only had sliced bread left. How does a sandwich shop run out of bread? I got the chicken pesto sandwich and was pleasantly surprised at how good it was. They toast all the subs so they come out hot and cheese is melted. It was a very simple menu but the sandwich was very tasty. I will definitely be returning here.
author: Kelly M.

description: I got meatball sub. Sub was good, like how they cut it with paper, also like sauce, meatballs a tiny rubbery though, good just not incredible. Ordered with my phone and picked up. I like that Asian lady kept saying, 5 minutes ready, that's kinda fast and awesome, and it was ready that quick!
author: Mary And Chris H.

description: Love the food, the workers, the prices, and did I mention the food? I have never had a bad experience here, even when there is a long line. These people know how to get stuff done!
author: C L.

description:
Finally!! An Affordable, Delicious sandwich spot in the hood. I'm not usually a sandwich girl but this Sando had me wanting more!! (oh and they have cranberry sauce:D The other sub place that used to be there never had it so i always left empty handed). The flavors and texture were both heavinly!
To top it off the place was sparkling clean which is always a thumbs up in my book. Nice job Bay Sub.. See you soon!!
author: Cheryl A.

description: I have been going to this place off and on for many years. I've never been disappointed. Today I had a large Italian sub. Absolutely delicious. The melted cheese on the bread with the entire thing toasted in their special oven is the best.
author: Bill H.

description: We stopped in here over the weekend to grab some lunch and it was quite yummy and very filling! The sandwiches were much more than what we were expecting, especially for the cheap price. Also, the owners were very friendly and treated us as if we were regulars (which a few came in while we were eating). If you're in the Pac Heights area I highly suggest stopping by for a quick bite to eat, its across from the Marc by Marc Jacobs store, which was very convenient ;)
author: Ash K.

description: This is the best sub place in the city bar none. I always try to stop by when I come to SF and I'm very picky when it comes to food. Enough said.
author: Next M.

description: I love this place! The sandwiches are great and the owners are very nice and friendly. I love going here everyday. The owners give great service and they are always welcoming. And don't listen to the lady with 2 stars because I went here the first week they opened and I was not disappointed. I highly recommend this place!
author: Queen E.
